review.title: Conversational Recommendation System with Unsupervised Learning
review.abstract: We will demonstrate a conversational products recommendation agent. This system shows how we combine research in personalized recommendation systems with research in dialogue systems to build a virtual sales agent. Based on new deep learning technologies we developed, the virtual agent is capable of learning how to interact with users, how to answer user questions, what is the next question to ask, and what to recommend when chatting with a human user.

metadata.title: Conversational Recommendation System with Unsupervised Learning

sections.text: Typically, a conversation agent needs tens of thousands of handwritten conversation data or rules for a particular domain. This is a major obstacle to introducing a conversation agent for a new domain. We will examine and demonstrate the effectiveness of the learning solution, even if there are no handwritten rules or handwritten training data. sections.heading: 2. SYSTEM IMPLEMENTATION
sections.text: Our system consists of several main components, as shown in Figure 1. Most components resemble a typical dialog system, except that a personalized recommendation engine is added and used by the policy component to influence machine activities.ar Xiv: 161 0.01 546v 1 [cs.C L] 22 Sep 2016

sections.heading: 2.1 User Intention Prediction and State Tracking
sections.text: In order to achieve this goal, users must provide values for the metadata required to order the agent, also referred to as slot value pairs [1]. For example, a pair [type = latte] describes the type of coffee ordered by the user as "latte." After each statement by the user, the prediction of the user's intention and the state tracking component must accurately predict and update the current user's intention and the state he is in. The state includes all the slot value pairs that the agent has so far received from the user, such as [food = Japanese, location = 95070]. Without requiring hand labeled data for each statement by the user, we developed a new, uncontrolled learning method to train the models used by this component. Our approach is to train a deep learning model [2] that learns from delayed rewards that orders are collected at the end of each business's commercial rewards.

sections.heading: 2.2 Personalized recommendation and learning
sections.text: Recommendation in conversations is an open area for research. In addition to the transaction history and demographic information of the user, which is normally used in traditional recommendation engines, our machine also has a range of additional information about the user's needs, such as a possible initial request from the user (i.e. a user query) or additional information collected during the conversation with the user. To better serve the users in our system, we have a recommendation system that is able to use this information to evaluate products, generate recommendations, receive user feedback, update the store and actively request additional user feedback.

sections.heading: 2.3 Machine utterance generation
sections.text: We will demonstrate two mechanisms for generating machine expressions within our system: the first is a template-based model with a statistical learning method for selecting a template and automatically adding the missing components in the selected template for each request to generate machine expressions; the second solution is based on a deep learning model (i.e. a sequence model for generating language sequences).

sections.heading: 3. DATA
sections.text: We trained the model with untagged data collected from a mobile app that provides personalized assistance to thousands of daily active users. It includes natural-language chats between many users and real human agents (assistants). In a successful chat session, a real human agent guides a user through the process of fulfilling a purchase order.
